title: NEXT-GENERATION BUILDING INFORMATION MODELING TO SUPPORT EVALUATION OF HUMAN BEHAVIOR IN BUILT ENVIRONMENTS
descriptions:
The proposed project, "NEXT-GENERATION BUILDING INFORMATION MODELING TO SUPPORT EVALUATION OF HUMAN BEHAVIOR IN BUILT ENVIRONMENTS," aims to address the limitations of current building information modeling (BIM) tools that focus primarily on physical and material characteristics, lacking context, intended use, and user considerations. These limitations result in an inability to predict a building's impact on future users' lives and activities and assess whether a building meets its intended users' needs.

The research aims to develop a comprehensive building modeling method that includes form, function, and use information in building models. By improving current BIM systems to incorporate user behavior and context, the project seeks to enhance the design of buildings and predict user behavior and interaction in the built environment more accurately.

The proposed research is grounded in the recognized impact of the built environment on life on Earth, emphasizing the importance of considering human behavior and context in building design. The project's outcomes are expected to result in better-designed buildings and an enhanced ability to predict user behavior and interaction in the built environment.

This grant proposal argues for the development of advanced BIM systems that go beyond physical aspects like lighting, energy consumption, and structural stability to include user behavior and context, ultimately leading to more sustainable and user-centric building design.

By addressing the current limitations of BIM tools, the proposed project has the potential to significantly impact the field of architecture and urban planning.
